summary: the 9-O-acetylation and de-O-acetylation are the most common modifications of sialic acids found in mammalian cell surface sialoglycoconjugates. these modifications can regulate a variety of biological phenomena, including endogenous lectin recognition, tumor antigenicity, virus binding, and complement activation. spermatogenesis is a complicated process of germ cell differentiation in adult testis. there are five types of germ cells, each at a specific developmental stage, found in the seminiferous tubules. they can be divided into three groups according to their DNA content. the cells were centrifuged and resuspended in 0.5 M sodium citrate solution (PH 4.5) the day before use, the cells were spun down and resuspended in PBS with 100 g/mL PI (propidium iodide) and fresh 0.1% DEPC. the cells were stained overnight at 4°C. cDNA library screening The colonies of full-length cDNA were screened by PCR. human testis Large-Insert cDNA Library (Clontech, Calif) was first converted into plasmid cDNA Library, and then an arrayed cDNA library. pEGFP-C2-HSEI and pEGFP-C2-HSEII were constructed using two sets of primers (HSEI: 5′-GGGGAATTCAATGATATGGTGCTGCAG-3′ and 5′-GGGGTCGACATTTAGCAACATTGCTCTG-3′) cells were imaged 40 hours after transfection on the fluorescence microscope. seminiferous tubules were collected in DMEM/F12, which contained collagenase. trypsin treatment and a brief treatment with DNase I were used to release the spermatogenic cells from seminiferous tubules. the suspension of cells was filtered with nylon mesh. H-Lse is highly expressed in 4C cells. the distribution of H-Lse in various human tissues was analyzed by Northern blot. the expected transcript of H-Lse was approximately 2.7 kb. the transcript of approximately 7.5 kb was exclusively expressed in the colon. negative control of sense probes confirmed the specificity of the results. spermatogonia proliferates in mitotic, meiotic, and postmeiotic phases. spermatocytes accomplish chromosomal synapsis and genetic recombination before two meiotic divisions. in the postmeiotic phase, haploid spermatids are remodeled into spermatozoa by the processes of acrosome formation, nuclear condensation, flagellar development, and loss of the majority of cytoplasm. they are thought to play an essential role in spermatogenesis at particular stages. mammalian cell surface sialoglycoconjugates, 9-O-acetylation and de-O-acetylation play an important role in the transition of antigenicity and transformation of intercellular cross-talk. the essential role of sialic acids modification in cellular communications may explain the presently observed wide distribution of H-Lse in all examined tissues. embryonic testis contains only two distinct cell types, spermatogonia and sertoli cells. the seminiferous epithelium of adult testis consists of germ cells at different stages of spermatogensis. the 4C cells found in adult testis include the primary spermatocytes and spermatogonia of G2/M stage, while 2C cells include spermatogonia of G0/G1 stage, secondary spermatocytes, and Sert specific esterase of influenza C has been found to arrest embryo development at the two-cells stage. it has also been reported that in vitro development of embryonic stem cells shows that expression level of Lse is low at the initiation of the development, followed by an increase at later stages.
